greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows, in which n-th row contains smallest set of n consecutive numbers with distinct prime signatures.
comment: Question: Given n with a prime signature say p^a*q^b*r^c... find a tight upper limit m such that there exists a number k, n < k < m with the same prime signature.
link: Giovanni Resta, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..190
example: Row 4 contains 6,7,8 and 9 with prime signatures p*q,p,p^3,p^2 respectively.
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, May 07 2003
ext: Corrected and extended by _Ray Chandler_, Aug 17 2003
